title: Variables
summary: In programming, a variable is like a container or a labeled box. It stores data values (like numbers or text) so you can refer to them and manipulate them later in your code. Without variables, we would have to hard-code every single value.
sample_question: Imagine you are building a game. Why would you use a variable for the 'Score' instead of just writing the number 0?

title: Loops
summary: Loops allow code to be repeated multiple times without writing the same lines over and over. A 'For Loop' is used when you know how many times to repeat (like 10 times). A 'While Loop' repeats as long as a certain condition is true (like while the player is still alive).
sample_question: If I want to print 'Hello' 100 times, which type of loop is best and why?

title: Functions
summary: A function is a block of code designed to perform a particular task. You 'call' the function whenever you need that task done. It helps keep code organized and reusable, so you don't repeat yourself (DRY principle).
sample_question: What is the main benefit of wrapping a complex calculation inside a function?
